Title: Externalization Lambda Interface Contract
Subtitle: Phase 5 — Natural Language Externalization

Sections.Title: Purpose
Content: This document defines the **canonical lambda calculus interface** used for **Phase 5 Natural Language Externalization** in the LOGOS system.
Its purpose is to ensure that every externalized linguistic artifact produced by LOGOS has a **stable, deterministic, implementation-agnostic mathematical representation** that:
- Is one-to-one with natural language output
- Is compatible with existing runtime lambda engines
- Is directly mappable to PXL grounding
- Remains valid across future runtime refactors

Sections.Title: Role of Lambda Calculus in Phase 5
Content: In Phase 5, lambda calculus functions as a **semantic carrier**, not a computation engine.
- Represents the **meaning structure** of a lexical term
- Is used as an **intermediate semantic form**
- Bridges natural language and PXL formal grounding
No lambda expression defined under this contract is executed at Phase 5.

Sections.Title: Allowed Lambda Expression Forms
Content: Only the following forms are permitted.

Sections.Title: Atomic Types
Content: Lexical lambda signatures MAY reference abstract semantic types, including but not limited to:
These types are **semantic placeholders**, not runtime classes.

Sections.Title: Function Signatures
Content: All functions MUST be explicitly typed.

Sections.Title: Terminal States
Content: Some lambda expressions may represent terminal semantic states, e.g.:
These MUST be represented as constants, not functions.

Sections.Title: Lambda Roles
Content: Each lexical entry MUST declare one of the following lambda roles:
Returns a truth-bearing or validation state
Transforms one semantic object into another
Binds two or more semantic objects
The declared role MUST align with the lambda signature.

Sections.Title: Prohibited Constructs
Content: Any lambda expression violating these rules is invalid.

Sections.Title: Relationship to PXL Grounding
Content: Each lambda expression serves as a **pre-formal semantic form** that is:
- Mappable to PXL propositions or modal states
This contract does not specify how the mapping occurs—only that it must be possible and unambiguous.

Sections.Title: Stability and Backward Compatibility
Content: Lambda expressions defined under this contract are:
- Runtime evolution does not break externalization meaning

Sections.Title: Usage by External Agents
Content: External agents (e.g., Claude) producing lexical entries MUST:
- Use only lambda forms permitted by this contract
- Avoid referencing runtime or implementation details
- Treat lambda expressions as **semantic signatures**, not code
Violations are grounds for rejection during arbitration.

Sections.Title: Final Invariant
Content: Natural language in LOGOS is not generated arbitrarily.
Lambda calculus is the **semantic interface**, not the execution engine.
This contract exists to ensure that every externalized statement of LOGOS has:

End_Marker: End of Externalization Lambda Interface Contract
